section.title: What can you do on the List view?
section.subsection: Filter the card list to isolate the cards you want to work with.

bullets.title: There are two ways you can update cards within the List view
bullets.item: individually, by clicking on a card. This lets you edit all details for a card including properties, description and tags.
in bulk, by selecting the cards you want to update and then selecting the actions you want to perform. You can update card property values, delete cards, add or update tags, or apply a transition.

subsection.title: Add or remove columns
subsection.p: Within the List view, you can hide existing columns, or add columns for property values. Click the Add / remove columns link to update the columns that display.

subsection.title: Sort cards
subsection.p: The card list view can also be sorted to view the cards in a specific order. Simply add the column you wish to sort by and select the column header. Select the header again to toggle between ascending and descending sort order. To change the sort criteria select a new column header.

subsection.title: Update URL
subsection.p: Each card view has a link called Update URL. This is identical to the browser address (URL), but gives you a quick way to create links to the current card view. You can use these links to send to people via email or instant messaging (IM), or to place on a website, blog or Mingle wiki page. In Windows, right-click on this link to bring up options for copying or sending.

subsection.title: Maximize the view
subsection.p: The card list view can be viewed in the maximized mode. This will allow for cleaner, more useful views when working with your Mingle cards.

subsection.title: Create favorites
subsection.p: If you've found a card List view that your team will use regularly, you can save this view. You can then turn this into a tab.
You can also create personal favorites from card list views.

section.subsection: The Import / Export component lets you export the cards in the current list, or import a list of cards from Excel.
